eu.bavenir.ogwapi.commons.messages

Class NetworkMessageResponse

  • java.lang.Object
    • eu.bavenir.ogwapi.commons.messages.NetworkMessage
      • eu.bavenir.ogwapi.commons.messages.NetworkMessageResponse

  • public class NetworkMessageResponse
extends NetworkMessage
    Extended NetworkMessage that represents a response. Same as request but with response from the remote site. There are many similarities between implementation of these two classes. This class contains extra fields for error indication, status code, status code reason and response body. The similarity to HTTP response is in place, since the OGWAPI's first design was to transport HTTP requests, though it can (and does) work with any other protocol. OGWAPI uses it like this: 1. Constructs an instance of this class and sets the requestId to match the request ID of the request that arrived previously and was the reason for starting the process that eventually lead into creation of this message. 2. Calls setResponseCode and setResponseCodeReason to values representing the outcome of the operation (either from Agent or internal). Also, it never forgets to set setError - error propagation down the line depends on it. 3. Calls setResponseBody and passes the response body from an Agent (or internal process). 4. If there is a content type set in the response from an Agent, the OGWAPI sets the same by setContentType. If not (such as when the response is a product of internal operation), it uses the same method to set it to application/json. 4. Builds the message by buildMessageJson and sends the string through the network. If there are any modification to this class, they will probably be about extending the range of fields that will be transported over the network. Don't forget to put the new field into the parser and builder. Note that such modification will make the new OGWAPI incompatible with the previous versions.
    Author:
    sulfo

                              org.apache.commons.configuration2.XMLConfiguration config,
                              java.util.logging.Logger logger)

        Parameters:

        logger - Logger of the OGWAPI.

      • NetworkMessageResponse

        public NetworkMessageResponse(org.apache.commons.configuration2.XMLConfiguration config,

                              java.lang.String responseCodeReason,
                              java.lang.String contentType,
                              java.lang.String responseBody)
        Sometimes it can be beneficial to create the response message all at once, and not fill it piece by piece.
        Parameters:
        config - Configuration of the OGWAPI.
        logger - Logger of the OGWAPI.
        error - Indicates an error during operation.
        responseCode - Numerical response code (see CodesAndReasons).
        responseCodeReason - Human readable code reason (see CodesAndReasons).
        contentType - Content type of the body.
        responseBody - Body of the response.

      • buildMessageString

        public java.lang.String buildMessageString()

        Returns:
        JSON String that can be sent over the network.
